de.systemagmbh.interfaces.table
Interface ISysCursoredTable

All Superinterfaces:
ISysTableModel
All Known Subinterfaces:
ISysTable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DummyISysCursoredTable, DummyISysTable
public interface ISysCursoredTable
extends ISysTableModel

This is the definition of a table that has a cursor to move through the table. The defined getValue(int) - methods act on the current row. (The current row is the row on which the cursor stands.)

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

isBeforeFirst

public boolean isBeforeFirst()
Get information if the current row is before the first one.

Returns:
true if the current column is before the first one. Else returns false.

absolute

public void absolute(int row)
Move to the given row.
The first row is 0.

Parameters:
row - The row to move to.

isValidRow

public boolean isValidRow()
Checks if the table is at a valid row.

Returns:
true if the table is not before the first and not after the last row.
